headline: Is Oracle Still Attractively Priced After Its Big AI and Cloud Driven Rally?
summary: Wondering if Oracle is still worth buying after its massive run, or if the smart move now is to wait for a better entry price? This article unpacks whether the current share price really lines up with the company’s long term potential. Oracle has cooled off recently, with the stock down roughly 1.9% over the last week and 22.0% over the past month, even though it is still up 21.1% year to date and 7.9% over the past year, and a huge 164.9% over three years and 261.0% over five years. Those...

summary: Oracle Corporation (NYSE:ORCL) is one of the Buzzing AI Stocks on Wall Street. On November 26, HSBC maintained its Buy rating on the stock with a $382.00 price target. The rating affirmation reflects optimism in Oracle’s execution and backlog visibility, but flags the company’s flexibility in finding large-scale data center buildouts. headline: Mythics Accelerates Oracle Multi-Cloud Momentum, Driving Transformation Across Leading Hyperscalers

headline: Salesforce’s Stock Is Historically Cheap as AI Risk Takes a Toll
summary: The maker of customer relationship management software reports earnings after the bell, and has recently pointed to better times ahead, forecasting double-digit revenue growth in the coming years.  “We need a change in sentiment for investors to take a look, and that will be driven by stability and an improvement in topline growth,” said Hilary Frisch, senior research analyst at ClearBridge Investments.  Salesforce’s stock price has been hammered by pessimism all year, plunging 30% in 2025 to make the company the second-worst performer in the Dow Jones Industrial Average and putting it among the 25 worst in the S&P 500 Index.

headline: Oracle initiated at Overweight: Wells Fargo sees ‘room to run’ in AI super-cycle
summary: Investing.com -- Wells Fargo initiated coverage of Oracle with an Overweight rating and a $280 price target in a note on Wednesday, arguing that the company is emerging as a leader in the AI infrastructure boom.

headline: The AI Trade Has Powered Wall Street Through Bitcoin’s Wobble. It Sets Up a December Rally.
summary: If  Bitcoin  late autumn slump was meant to drive a stake into the heart of the animal spirits that have powered risky assets higher for much of the past three years, the stock market appears largely unscathed and more than willing to roll the dice into the final weeks of December.  Bitcoin prices, which are inexorably tied to investor sentiment, have rebounded firmly over the past two days, taking the world’s largest cryptocurrency back above $93,000 and stoking risk appetite in markets around the world.

content.title: The AI Trade Has Powered Wall Street Through Bitcoin’s Wobble. It Sets Up a December Rally.
content.summary: If  Bitcoin  late autumn slump was meant to drive a stake into the heart of the animal spirits that have powered risky assets higher for much of the past three years, the stock market appears largely unscathed and more than willing to roll the dice into the final weeks of December.  Bitcoin prices, which are inexorably tied to investor sentiment, have rebounded firmly over the past two days, taking the world’s largest cryptocurrency back above $93,000 and stoking risk appetite in markets around the world.

headline: Rimini Street Launches Rimini Agentic UX™ to Bring Agentic AI Innovation to ERP Processes
summary: LAS VEGAS, December 03, 2025--Rimini Street, Inc. (Nasdaq: RMNI), the Software Support and Agentic AI ERP Company™, and the leading third-party support provider for Oracle, SAP and VMware software, today introduced Rimini Agentic UX™, an intelligent, AI-driven user engagement layer that streamlines ERP process execution for efficiency and significant savings, delivering persona- and role-based automation and productivity enhancements without the need for costly ERP Software upgrades or migration

headline: United States Business Intelligence Software Market Analysis 2025-2033 by Technology, Deployment, Enterprise, End User, States and Competitive Landscape
summary: The United States Business Intelligence Software Market is set for significant growth, increasing from US$ 11.35 Billion in 2024 to US$ 27.49 Billion by 2033 with a CAGR of 10.33% from 2025 to 2033. Key drivers include rising data-driven decision-making, enhanced analytics, and demand for data visualization tools across industries like finance and healthcare. headline: Oracle debt's fear gauge spikes, CBS hits NFL viewer record
summary: Yahoo Finance Senior Producer John Hyland tracks Wednesday's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute. Delta (DAL) says the recent federal US government shutdown has cost the company $200 million. A fear gauge measuring Oracle's (ORCL) debt has reached its highest level since 2009. Paramount Skydance's (PSKY) CBS said its Chiefs–Cowboys NFL game on Thanksgiving set a regular-season audience record. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

Delta (DAL) says the recent federal US government shutdown has cost the company $200 million.

A fear gauge measuring Oracle's (ORCL) debt has reached its highest level since 2009.

Paramount Skydance's (PSKY) CBS said its Chiefs–Cowboys NFL game on Thanksgiving set a regular-season audience record.

Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.
